reviews.text: I am in my second year at Elizabethtown College and I have to say, I am having the best time of my life! All of the professors are so helpful and all staff I have met have been kind. Generally, all the students look out for one another. This college has taught me a lot about my interests/strengths and how I can use them to benefit my future career. All the courses I have taken have been challenging, but SOO rewarding. The professors care about your learning and your success. As you can see, I could go on forever about how awesome this school is! Even though I am only in my second year, I already worry about graduating because I never want to leave.

Obviously, as my college which I am currently attending I am extremely biased in writing this review. However, I love this place. Etown is the place where I can proudly call my home, and I recommend it to outsiders wholeheartedly. If you come and become a Blue Jay, you are no longer an outsider. This college actually brings you in and makes you feel at home. I transferred from another college during my sophomore year of undergrad, and Etown has made me feel as though I am finally accepted. Nothing against larger schools, I loved my college that I transferred from and it had 30k students versus the 2k here at Etown. However, you really have to experience this place to believe in what I'm talking about here. I think you will find that Etown is a great place to stay, outsider or insider.
Great campus and college. Visited with my family a few times.  My son chose this college.  I think it’s an excellent choice.
I studyed 2 semesters at E-town college as exchange student.
Very nice and friendly campus

I went here from 2008-2011 and obtained my degree in Occupational Safety and Environmental Health. The program was wonderful and nationally recognized. My internship was with a great company (paid and per diem), and now hold a wonderful position. I made many life long friends and still keep in contact with old professors. One of the best decisions I ever made.

Went to school here for undergraduate back in 2007. Transferred after a year. It's pretty much your standard small university. Not very diverse. Some classes are pretty huge some are small and more personal. All in all a very vanilla school. Perfect for your average sheltered white boy or girl from the suburbs. If you're a minority, don't expect to be represented much. The demographics are pretty homogeneous here. Not much has changed.

Beautiful campus. Great education. A local college with a truely hometown feel. The streets and grounds around campus give it more of a park feel than a college campus. The swans and the pond make for a great walking destination on a nice day. All the sports fields are in pristine condition. Flower beds and trees always beautiful. The buildings range from some of the oldest in the county to very modern. The new dorms and library are state of the art. The school really strives to make sure students are safe and happy.

There are plenty of positive things about this establishment, but sadly, they just don’t outweigh the negatives. I really sympathize with the students who felt belittled by professors or unassisted by them because they just like to wave their PhD around and say “read the syllabus”. My advisor was one of those people, unfortunately, and it ultimately made me change my major. That’s my biggest issue with the professors. Furthermore, the police department is just a joke. I contacted them twice, once for a stolen purse and once for a parking permit. And they belittled me, berated me, and spoke down to me as if I were the biggest inconvenience in the room. I will not be going to them anymore. Lastly, when the white supremacy group came to MU and hung posters about their campaign, the school told everyone the pictures of the posters were photoshopped and that we are just this pristine, diverse school that couldn’t possibly have any of that— do NOT come here if you’re looking for diversity. As a generally liberal school, we are pretty closed minded sometimes.  Ridiculous. I’m only in my second semester, and I’m hoping it gets better.
Don’t recommend living at the university but I believe it’s a great value for commuters.

Smokehouse is a solid visit with a good selection of BBQ staples for a decent price. Nestled in the heart of Amish country, you really can't ask for much more than Smokehouse offers. The barbecue is tender and tasty, the sides are quite good, and the PA dutch staple shoo fly pie is delicious. A mostly open dining area provides a laid back country atmosphere, and where else can you pick up a jar of jam and straw hat or a bonnet at the general store on your way out?

This was my first visit here and I was quite pleased. When we arrived it was quite empty, but it did not take long to start getting filled up once it got a little closer to dinner. 

The wait staff was very friendly and on top of keeping drinks full and making sure nothing else was needed.

When it came to the food I can say it was very good. I got the pulled pork sandwich with cheese and pickles, paired along with the apple sauce the flavor was great. They do not seem to skimp on the amount of meat on the sandwich either. I had also got a side of mac n cheese which just helped top the meal off. 

I can say I would come back here again with no problem

Nothing Special, Not A Fan of this Restaurant.  Seating was a joke. We arrived before our friends, but weren't allowed to sit at a table until they arrived. I get that full party seating is wise for a weekend, but on a THURSDAY night when NO ONE was there?  Use some common sense Smokehouse! They need a total Gift Shop makeover; nothing but manufactured "gifts" aka China Junk.  They could make more money and have a better selection with local handcrafted items, which are prevalent in Amish Country. Sad non-use of local talent. I gave them 2 Stars because food was Ok.

I ordered a brisket sandwich and it was tough. The brisket was not tender and the fat was not rendeed down. At all. I've smoked a number of briskets and I can tell you that this was the worst brisket that I've ever had. Brisket should be soft and can be cut with a fork. This brisket had to be cut with a knife. I was not impressed. The pork that my brother got was good. The sauces were good and the service was good. Other than that I thought the food was mediocre at best.

The bad: Their attitude when you ask for a table other than the one the "greeter" assigns you. 

The good: Food here is great,  I love their complimentary cornbread. I Always bring visiting friends.

I'm so glad they are back to being a dine in restaurant. I've got such amazing memories of their former location out by the outlets where they were my introduction to Thai cuisine. Sitting down to this excellent Evil Jungle Princess dish last night was a rush if nostalgia, I had that sense of "this is what it's supposed to taste like" almost as with the comfort of Mom's cooking.

The appetizer spring roll and ice cream with banana and peanut butter stuffed egg roll were also fantastic. Do yourself a favor and grab a seat at the new version of the familiar Thai restaurant you've been eating at market for years. It's just better fresher.

Enjoyed a wonderfully crafted dinner at our new favorite restaurant. It was love at first sight after reading their black board touting the wonderful local farms and businesses providing fresh ingredients. The first bite sealed the deal.
Great food and good people who work there!
Delicious Massaman curry tonight
Really great food. Waitress was friendly though did not introduce herself.  2 ppl at our table of 4 knew her and had requested her to serve us. Me and one other did not know her.  I would go back.

The  staff was very attentive and prompt. The bottomless cup of coffee was appreciated and quite good. 
I ordered the Cajun chicken and it was delightfully seasoned and very close to authentic Cajun. 
Everything tasted great, and was a generous portion, even the salad. 
The plate was literally sizzling when served so it's temperature was hot as it should be. 
My only complaint, and this seems to be true of many restaurants, I was asked if I needed cream with my ordered coffee, I said no, but they brought cream anyways. 
Otherwise the meal was great with great service.
This is a wonderful older restaurant to eat at.  Food has always been great, breakfast, lunch or dinner. Very casual,  and prices are good.
Food is always awesome and super reasonable in price.
The service was  great coffee always topped off,water glasses  filled. The food was good.

They Lie to me NO Vegan Option & Waiting  There for Nothing waste of time at the Table. I Did NOT Like What Was on The Menu & it was Disgusting. So I left quick. I Did not want to be Seen There Either. Because I'm kinda famous. Definitely Not My Type Of Place.

I am vegan and one of my friends who went with me eats halal (my friend enjoyed the lamb). We loved the food and the experience so much that we came back the next night also. The staff and owners are very nice. Next time I am back in Albuquerque I will eat here again.

My favorite Indian food lunch buffet here in Albuquerque.  We make it a point to go meet at least once a month with our friends.  They have all the great stuff you'd expect at a Indian food buffet and they do a great job at all of it.  It's typically bustling and busy at lunch, but with several dining areas and attentive polite staff that are constantly on top of everything, it's always a pleasurable experience.

First time coming here, and first time eating Indian food, and I have to say that I loved it! The location is pretty old and might be in need for an update, but they make up for it with the great food. I went for lunch, and they have their buffet, which makes it really easy to get a sample of their offerings
Always wonderful!  Have been a patron for years, and it's always a good bet.  Had the baked eggplant and lamb meatballs.....great!  Always have an appetizer.

My only regret is that I live in California. I have been to Good in Plenty at least  a half dozen times during some classes I took for work back east. I prefer sitting at the long tables meeting new people from all over the country. The food is beyond delicious. I think I have tried everything on the menu. I remember the mash potatoes were to die for. I hope I make it back to visit this wonderful restaurant. I remember all the staff being so friendly. Bless you all.

I stopped today around noon  and really enjoyed the atmosphere and food was excellent. My waitress Kim was so extra nice and was so sweet that it made my visit even more enjoyable.  I have been there numerous times before but today just seemed most enjoyable. I will definitely be a return customer and I highly recommend that you go there if you are looking for a nice dinner.  PS. Good 'N Plenty offers a free meal if it's the day before, day of, or day after of your birthday. Enjoy.

Very nice. The food was excellent. My boyfriend and I chose the communal style dinner, where you are seated at a big table and share a meal with people you don't know. Took me out of my comfort zone.  But that was a good thing😁

Excellent Pennsylvania Dutch food! Delicious mashed potatoes, buttered noodles, fried chicken, ham, corn, perfect pepper cabbage, etc.  Then there are the many dessert choices! Fantastic food and service!  It is also fun to sit and talk to the other people at your long table.  It makes for a homey and enjoyable experience!
I had an awesome time. The food was great and our waitress Lindsay, did an excellent job. This was not my first visit and God willing will not be my last. I'm from Philadelphia
